website_summaries.verdict: A good budget recoil pad that does not sacrifice comfort and protection to lower cost.
pros: Recoil pad has just enough thickness to reduce the recoil kick without feeling bulky
Adds a little bit of mass to the rear of the gun, which helps accuracy
cons: Brown color option is too light for most natural wood grains, especially darker tints

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for a KSG
customer_reviews.text: I have this installed on my KSG. Definitely made a difference in felt recoil. Shoulder feels fine after a long range session.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Nice pad, I use it for military surplus.  See compatibility in my review
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these after tearing 3 different Butler Creek slip on pads. Those are junk, avoid them. The rubber tears as you're putting it on. This is a nice pad, much better quality than the Butler Creek. Much more comfortable and easier to slip on. The medium pad fits the following surplus military rifles: 98 Mauser style rifles (Turk, Yugo, German are the ones I've tried so far) Type 99 Arisaka Mosin Nagant 91/30 Finn M39 Mosin Nagant Egyptian Hakim 8mm semi auto Enfield No1 MK 3
customer_reviews.author: toolness1

customer_reviews.title: Shoot 'em up!  Feel less kick.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small one and it works for my Remington 870 Tactical...but I think the medium may fit better. It does help soften any blow though. It helps you get the gun right in the shoulder pocket, a good cheek weld, and stays in place if you shoot it right. Oddly enough, if you shoot at a weird angle it makes the thing start to fall off so it helped me ensure I was shooting the gun correctly. I did 350 7.5 shot shells, 60 slug shells, and 100 buck shells over 4 days with no bruising, no tenderness. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Simon The Great

customer_reviews.title: Great recoil
customer_reviews.text: Great recoil pad for my marlin 30-30. This pad is the best on the market. Your shoulder will love it. I recommend it for any high power rifle. The small size is perfect for my marlin. It fits snug and no damage to the wood stock.
customer_reviews.author: Sal M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pad - better than the competition
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pad to replace my Limb Saver slip on pad due to my continued frustration with it grabbing my clothing when pulling the gun up. The hard plastic in the top corner eliminates the frustration. Felt recoil is about the same as Limb Saver. It looks much nicer on the gun. I use the pads to help get some length on the stock. The recoil reduction is a secondary concern for me. I purchased a Medium size which fits both my CZ Upland Ultralight and CZ Bob White perfectly. Now if I could only shoot a bit better!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Made A Huge Difference
customer_reviews.text: I had a two day Appleseed class with a Marlin .22...this was obviously not a recoil issue, but it has no padding or rubber on the stock butt, just hard edged plastic. When you pull it in to your shoulder it just digs and grinds, really uncomfortable for all day shooting. Took the stock measurements, it was just a hair under the maximum length for the small size so that's what I bought and it fit like a glove. It really made a hug difference, it's like having a gel pad for your shoulder. I can't speak to its long term durability, but so far it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the winner
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this one and a Gel Filled based on research and reviews. Appearance wise this one looks more seamless on the stock and doesn't visually stand out as much. Adds a bit of length to the gun, and in comparison to the gel filled it nests better when set to fire. This one was placed on a 20 ga Tristar O/U that had a bit of a recoil to it and was felt in comparison to the Gel Filled that was on a 12 ga CZ Semi-Auto. I don't dislike this one, but at the end of the day the, I ordered another of the Gel Filled one for another shotgun, so this one wasn't the winner.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Ruger 77/44 fit (modern polymer stock)
customer_reviews.text: Fits the 77/44. Works better than no pad. The polymer stock on the newer 77/44's doesn't do a great job of absorbing the recoil. Your probably wondering, "what recoil?. Keep in mind this is a VERY light rifle. Theres no rifle weight to absorb the 1800 ft-lbs of energy (.223 is 1200 at best). the cartridge generates in a rifle. The stock is very rigid and therefore transfers that recoil into the edges of the stock (hollow) and into your shoulder. Added this and it helps (adding weight will too, such as a scope). Fit pretty good, doesn't fall off. Doesn't look terrible
customer_reviews.author: xP.1337

customer_reviews.title: Mossberg MVP rifle in 308
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a Mossberg MVP RIFLE in 308. I hated shooting this bolt action rifle because my shoulder would get so bruised after shooting 4-6 shots. I put this recoil pad and it made a difference. No more bruising but I did feel the recoil. This is well worth the product. I gave the only 3 stars because later on I still was sore but no bruising.
customer_reviews.author: Liezl Torres

customer_reviews.title: Too  big for an 870 with a youth stock.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife's Remington 870 with a youth stock. It does a great job of reducing recoil, and she can shoot without get a sore shoulder, where she was having to quit after 4-5 shots with the factory recoil absorber. The only problem is that it is too big to fit the youth stock, I had to wrap some tape around the end of the stock in order for the pad to fit securely. I would still recommend this recoil pad, but be aware that even the small size is too big for a youth stock.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Pachmayr Decelerator Slip-on recoil butt pad - Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a followup to my original post. Finally got to to shoot with Decelerator installed, "WOW, game changer". I am 68 yrs young and the old shoulder is not as strong, so the Decelerator really helps. Took shots with and without, can feel difference. As I stated in earlier post, mine is a medium, for 20inch barrel 336C, 30-30. Highly recommend. Ordered for my Marlin 336C, 20 inch barrel, walnut wood stock. Slipped on with no effort. Feels very comfortable. Tight enough to stay in place, yet easy to remove with low effort. I ordered the medium size. Very happy with results.
customer_reviews.author: S. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Cuts recoil dramatically plus is great looking.
customer_reviews.text: I have these pads (medium black) on two shotguns and couldn't be more pleased with their fit and performance. The Rem 1100 with brown hardwood stock looks great with the black pad (matches the blued steel). Surprisingly same pad also fits my HD Mossberg 6-position synthetic stock very well, and looks great. Simple to slip on or off, but fits perfectly and stays snug in use. Great reduction in recoil makes these guns much more fun to shoot. Nice design, good quality, good price, great appearance.
customer_reviews.author: oldned92

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I needed to add an inch or so to the LOP of a Rem. Mdl 7 synthetic stock. I measured my height and greatest width at the end of the factory recoil pad and the dimensions were right inside the stated range for this slip on pad. Stretched a little to install it, slid right on and it grips tight. Perfect adjustment to LOP and gives me the eye relief for my scope I was looking for. The black color blends nicely with my stock and is hardly noticeable. Seems like a well made quality product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dragoen

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: The medium size on my new Mossberg Silver Reserve Over/Under 12/20 combo is a perfect fit. Went to range today for first time shooting clays. Shot 25 rounds through 20 gauge barrels first with the expected mild recoil. Then went through a dozen 12 gauge shells with about double the recoil compared to 20 gauge.....but shoulder suffered no bruises or aches or pains like experienced in the past with my 12 gauge Winchester 97 shotgun. Thumbs up. :)
customer_reviews.author: Notwain

customer_reviews.title: Good buy way more vision than stock recoil pad
customer_reviews.text: Good product removed original recoil pad on my maverick 88 12g shotgun instantly you can feel the difference in cushion on your shoulder I bought the medium size not gonna lie when installing I did not think it was the right size (too small) you have to stretch it and finagle it on however it turns out it is the right size I much rather have it tight and snug on the but stock than to buy the large one and have it possibly be loose I have yet to feel the impact of the recoil with this pad and or the durability of this item. As of now I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Art C.

customer_reviews.title: Tames heavy recoil
customer_reviews.text: This pad does a great job on taming heavier recoil, or even just to make a lot of bench shooting more tolerable/enjoyable. I shoot a .30-06 Highwall single shot, and when shooting in any position off a bench, it's more than tolerable. But if you work up a load, or just do some supported shooting on a bench, the recoil has nowhere to go but right into your shoulder (regardless of your technique.) This pad really helps. It fits the stock and butt plate really well, and doesn't look half bad. It will help extend your shooting day, help reduce recoil induced flinch. It's a great investment (even if you're not a wussy.)
customer_reviews.author: Ed D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Recently added a Kel-Tec KS7 to my collection and for home defense. It is a cool looking little bullpup but kicks like a mule with slugs. I figured I would give the Pachmayr Decelerator (small) a try. Seller delivered in less than 24 hours, even the package was easy to open (sometimes you need a ball peen hammer & a blowtorch to remove product from those plastic packages). Decelerator was out of the package and installed in 3 minutes. Great snug fit & easy to "install". Most importantly, it should give me at least another 500 rounds before this little monster tears my AC joint.
customer_reviews.author: J Max

customer_reviews.title: Well-made product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to shoot with this recoil pad, but the fit and finish of the product are excellent. It grips well to the wood stock (satin finish) on my Remington 1100, but it doesn't grip quite as well as the Limbsaver recoil pad when I test it by hand (which would never happen under practical field use). That said, the pad held position when drawing it up and down to get a feel for it on the gun.
customer_reviews.author: G-FOURce

customer_reviews.title: Second best way to spend money on rubber
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product...placed on custom mosin nagant which kicks like a mule...this pad made a world of difference...unfortunately it did so good I put about 100 rounds down field without thinking about it...the day after my shoulder felt like it was caved in.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Nice, universal fit pad. Comments on using with a Mini-14...
customer_reviews.text: The "small" its my old Mini-14 pretty well. I wouldn't say "perfect"...it's not custom molded for the Mini-14, of course. The butt of the Mini-14 is curved, which leaves a bit of a gap, and the overall fit is leaves a small gap on the sides of the stock. It's not a real tight fit..slides off without much effort, and it's the friction of the rubber that keeps it from falling off. But, for a universal fit, slip-on pad, it makes the stock very comfortable and makes a nice extension on the Mini-14. High quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Sniffer Customs

customer_reviews.title: Does what it was advertised to do.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Remington 1100 and a Browning Citori 12ga shotguns and both had their stocks cut down for me. I've been wanting a replacement recoil pad for a long time and bought the Pachmayr Decelerator Slip On Recoil Pads for each gun, so I bought the 'small'. It fit easily and stays on without a problem even after 1,000's of rounds. Very happy with both guns now and with the recoil pad.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Depth of the pocket could be deeper.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, came on time, looks great, doesn't snag on a shirt when mounting the gun, seems very shock absorbent (haven't fired the shotgun yet but you can squeeze and release it to get a sense of it). Only one drawback, the pocket depth (as it slips onto the butt-stock) seemed shallow and left me wondering if it could pop out if the pad were to be pushed sideways. I just put some double-sided velcro inside the pocket as I don't plan to remove the pad anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Recoil Pad not because I need Recoil Protection but to add Grip and But Stock Protection to my CZ 455 American in 22LR. That is A Beartooth Stock But Stock Cover 2.0 that I bought on Amazon that went over the Pachmayer Decelerator. I ordered a Size Medium. And Fit Perfect. Went on Easy and Very Well Made. I love the way it Looks and Only Added about One Inch to the Length of the Stock. I like to take Care of my Rifles. This Worked Out Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Silecchio

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, great performance.
customer_reviews.text: The Small fits the Boyd Prairie Hunter stock very well. The black Pachmayr on the Pepper laminate stock looks great as well. Performs much better in absorbing the recoil of the .308 Ruger American Rifle over the lightweight Boyd pad. The Medium works well for the Stoeger M3K I have. A little too easy to get on, so I may need to use something to make sure it is secure. Dampens the recoil from shooting slugs and 00-Buck quite nicely. Only concern is if it will work loose on hotter days, but I'e got a while until that's an issue in NE Ohio.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Stanczak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a Rem. 1100. I removed the plastic but plate before I installed it. I was not looking to increase the length much. The hard plastic but plate was very slippery and the new pad took care of that. It is the nicest looking slip on pad I have seen and does a good job reducing felt recoil.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer in Mazo

customer_reviews.title: I modified it for my 1886
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile but I removed material from the inside to allow the points of the metal crescent butt plate to sink in further and leave less of a gap. It's not a perfect fit but it definitely reduced the recoil with non +P 45-70 loads at the range. Not sure if I would trust it for hunting. It seems like whatever company would make a recoil pad for a crescent butt plate could sell a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: Range Day Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these previously (smaller size) to use on a Mosin Nagant and two Mausers, and figured they'd work just as well on our two new M1 Garands. These were the next size larger and they're a perfect fit. My son and I put 120+ rounds thru the two Garands and these pads greatly reduced the recoil we felt....strongly recommend their use!
customer_reviews.author: S. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on the Hatfield SGL. (The $99 Walmart Shotgun for those that don't know) Provided a nice extra 1" LOP for my long arms. Took an immense amount of the recoil off, I can actually send slugs downrange more than twice. Excellent product, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: PreparedPatriot

customer_reviews.title: Solved Length of Pull Issue
customer_reviews.text: This added the length of pull I needed to comfortably shoulder a newly purchased Yugoslavian SKS. I haven't yet stripped the cosmoline from my SKS, so without firing yet, I cannot attest to the actual recoil reduction. My sole purpose for buying this pad was to add a little extra length to the buttstock, which is exactly what I now have. Excellent Product - Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Jon Freeman

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: NOTE THAT I BOUGHT THE LARGE SIZE, NOT THE MEDIUM WHICH THE MAKER RECOMMENDS. THE MEDIUM SIZE MIGHT HAVE BEEN A BIT DIFFICULT TO MOUNT, BUT I HAVE NOT ACTUALLY TRIED TO DO THAT. 1. This product does fit on to my Ruger M77 rifle which measures 5&1/4 inches vertical at the far rear end of the butt. 2. The rubber in this product has some "give" to it, unlike the Ruger built-in recoil pads on my M77 and my Ruger Mini-14. The Ruger pads are like concrete. 3. There is no wiggle left or right, up or down between the rifle butt and the recoil pad. 4. .When I actually shoot this rifle, I will amend these comments.
customer_reviews.author: David W Grill

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Good fit but not perfect. It moves or will slide to one side after you remove it from your shoulder. I used it on all 3 of my 10/22 Ruger Carbines and it was the same with all of them. Some guys can live with it but I can't. I want it tight - no sliding around. It's up to you. I am sure with a larger rifle it would fit much, much better. Just not with a rifle with a narrow stock, or butt. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: 10/22 with Hogue Overmolded stock  Small
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10/22 in a Hogue overmold stock. I bought this pad for a little extra length of pull. It gave me about an 1+ inch. It fit like a glove. If anything I would want it tighter. Slipped on easy. Is not loose. Looks like it will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Blade Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, quality product and a good value. It didn't work for me though, as the pad portion is a full 1" thick and it added more length of pull to my rifle than I needed. If you can use that much length added, it's a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Mark1958

customer_reviews.title: Works and improved LOP
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a Stoeger M3K Freedom. Added about an inch which was great and it takes a little more shock away making 250- 300 round days a little more shoulder friendly. No issues with sticking or slipping. Works like you'd want and expect.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: SImple, inexpensive and prevents pain.
customer_reviews.text: The pull on my Mosin Nagant rifle is too short for me anyway and this pad helps with that. It's main function is to reduce recoil and it does that well. Instead of wanting to quit shooting after 10 rounds, I can shoot a lot more without discomfort, using this pad.
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job at reducing recoil.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this recoil pad to put on a Swiss K-31 7.5x55mm rifle I had glass-bedded and free-floated in a Boyd's Custom Stock. This made a huge difference versus the original military surplus stock with a metal pad, and a big difference versus the plastic plate on my custom stock. I used a "small" size, but a medium size would probably be a fine fit as well, as the small is almost too small. What can I say? No modification needed, it looks great, installs easier than anything else, and it absorbs a good portion of the punishing recoil. I was concerned it wouldn't fit around the cheek riser, but that wasn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Xaevian

customer_reviews.title: It's great.
customer_reviews.text: Put it on a 3", 12 gauge pump, extended mag, what we used to call a riot gun. Only shoot 00 and slugs. It will wear you out. The new pad is very soft and basically invisible once it's on. Easy on, easy off, but won't come loose by itself.
customer_reviews.author: William Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Savior of my shoulder from my Mosin
customer_reviews.text: This thing is downright amazing. The small slipped right onto my Mosin and hasnt slipped off yet. I have put about 100 rounds through it since attaching the pad and I cannot believe how well this thing works. No more bruises, no more injuries, no more laying a folded blanket over my shoulder while I shoot. I 100% recommend this thing to anyone and everyone who needs to reduce the recoil. I was super skeptical that it had the cohonays to stop my Nagant, her name Is Olga and she kicks like a rabid bear. But by golly miss molly, this here pad has tamed my Russian beast.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Slip on pad for Auto 5 Browning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the medium size for my 1952 Browning Auto 5. Fit is spot on and makes the guns length of pull great for my 6' frame. A properly set up and maintained. ( good springs) auto 5 really is a soft shooter so my purchase was more geared toward making the gun fit me without altering the stock. The angle at the top rear of the pad seems to help with a snag free mount.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: packs a good punch when shooting slugs
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Kel-Tec KSG shotgun. That shotgun, since it is so small, packs a good punch when shooting slugs. I added a brake and this recoil pad and it makes shooting the KSG so so much better!!! Very happy with it... The small fits perfectly on my KSG also!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff.R35

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great! Slips on my over under easily with a nice snug fit. The plastic insert helps to not bunch up on your shirt when you bring it up to mount. It added a perfect length of pull for me. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sugar Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: I liked the Limbsaver slip-on better
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about, I liked the Limbsaver slip-on better. Trialed with a Remington 700 .30-06 shooting 180gr. 5-6 rounds with this and I was still feeling significant recoil compared to Limbsaver. That was my personal experience take it for what its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Tames the raging kicking  bull in my ksg
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a ksg and it made all the difference,It went from feeling like I got kicked by a bull to more subtle like a 20 gauge before I put this on after the second shot I seriously dreaded firing anymore but with this I thoroughly enjoy dumping two 7 round tubes down range!if I could only do one upgrade on my shotgun this pad is the winner hands down!!
customer_reviews.author: Macgolf

customer_reviews.title: For plinking... yeah, duty use.... Nope
customer_reviews.text: Its good and all but honestly, i dont feel like it is for someone who needs a gun to trust for their life. This pad just feels like its gonna come back and bite you. Glad i got to test it out but sending her back unfortunately..
customer_reviews.author: Lil brandon.

customer_reviews.title: Best add on for a ksg12
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the best purchase I could've made for my kel-tec ksg 12. Without this the gun kicks like a mule! But now, it's so comfortable to shoot. By the way, buy a medium if your getting it for a ksg 12. Some people say small, but I feel that is too tight. The medium is just right since you have to take it off for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Rheynger

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This provides a huge cushion for extended shooting. Usually 75 rounds of trapshooting left me a little bruised, but this really softens up the blow. And it gives me the extra 1 1/14" stock length that has made my shooting much better. It increased pull length to around 16 1/2" which is perfect for my 6' 4" height. Now a 75- 100 round trapshooting session leaves me with no pain which I think is extraordinary. I didn't mention that I slide this on on top of my existing butt-stock & recoil pads. I switch it between my Remington 870 & 1100 & it works great for both. Best $25.00 I have spent in a long while.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stone

customer_reviews.title: 10/22, small fits fine
customer_reviews.text: Ruger 10/22, with American Rimfire Modular stock system, small seems to fit just fine on High Comb, Standard Pull Module, just a hair small on the vertical, but that seems to help hold it on. I just got it tonight, any issues, and I'll update this review. I got this to extend the length of pull a little.
customer_reviews.author: Reporter007

customer_reviews.title: Pachmayr Decelerator Slip-On Pad:  Great in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great fit on single shot, H&R 20 gauge, youth sized shotgun. This made the stock length about 3/4 inch longer, making it perfect for adult shooters now. Rubber texture is just right-not sticky or mushy-and will not get caught on clothing when shouldering shotgun. The harder rubber/plastic insert on/in the upper back end is perfect to help quick shouldering of the gun. Well thought out and high quality manufacturing. Also, received the product quickly and on-time from Amazon prime. Could not be happier!--Tom
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Velez

customer_reviews.title: KSG/KS7 owner approved
customer_reviews.text: Have one for my Kel-Tec KSG and KS7. Wow the difference in felt recoil. I would put a % on it but it’s truly easy to notice the difference. Doesn’t interfere with any aspect of cycle or takedown.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great recoil pad
customer_reviews.text: I have a Remington R-25 and the medium pad fits nicely. However, I wish it was a bit snugger though because it's rather easy to push on...and pull off. As long as I don't "try" to pull it off, it should stay put. Also, I had to trim a small amount off on the bottom for the sling stud to pass through. The rubber is super supple and provides plenty of cushion. I haven't taken my rifle to the range yet, but it doesn't take a rocket scientist to know that this thing will reduce shoulder fatigue(not that an AR10 has much recoil to begin with).
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder saver - great price
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a bolt action .308 and noticed the difference right away. Lots of rounds at the range and should feels much better that when I used to run just 10 or 15 rounds through it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This pad gave me the added length I needed for proper skeet shooting. I really only got it to add the length and the recoil cushion is kind of an added benefit. Very nice product and easy to install. I am going to try it on my 30-06 and see how it helps the length on it and yes on that a little extra cushion will be nice
customer_reviews.author: bluewingjb

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and it works.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. On some milsurp rifles, the butt stock is often shorter than modern sporting rifles. This one is used on a sporterized Arisaka and gives me the right length of pull and also reduces the recoil. Being a slip on, I can also take it off for the winter months when I wear heavy coats and keep the same length of pull.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great on a CVA Hunter, 35 Whelen.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly over the existing pad and really helps soften the pounding this rifle gives. The extra length helps the gun fit better too. Might get another one for my other rifles. Very happy..
customer_reviews.author: D. Stamper

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this sooner. Looks great, fits perfect, absorbs recoil comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: Edit; 11-6-16 It's been a year now with this on my rifle. It is still as good as the day I put it on. Never moves and hasn't lost any of its absorption. This was money well spent! Just what my Remington 700 needed. I initially had the Remington pad on there even after reading all the reviews about it not fitting right. Well, they were all right, and it looked terrible. This one is a perfect fit (make sure to measure first) . Absorbs the recoil very nicely and mine stays in place... Absolutely love it. Actually looks good on the gun too.
customer_reviews.author: John m

customer_reviews.title: the bruising is definitely lessened a great deal. Used with mosin nagant and Finn m39
customer_reviews.text: Used this last weekend, the bruising is definitely lessened a great deal. Used with mosin nagant and Finn m39, shot about 200 rounds and was not as sore as I was without the decelerator a month ago after only 100 rounds. Plus what little discomfort I had was gone in a day. Without, took a few days. Would highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nate H

customer_reviews.title: Had doubts, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this slip on pad would help on my 12 ga. O/U shotgun, but that's exactly what it did. No bruising in my shoulder and my cheek wasn't beat up anymore by the stock kicking up on it after a day's worth of shooting sporting clays. The felt recoil is slighty more than that of a semi auto shotgun. The only potential issue others might find is that it adds about an inch to the stock, but since I have long arms it wasn't an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Country Lobster

customer_reviews.title: my shoulder thanks me for installing this
customer_reviews.text: fit well on Browning A5 (Light Twelve). this shotgun kicks like a mule and this thing tames it right down. fit perfect, no trimming or adjusting. fits good in shoulder pocket while shooting.
customer_reviews.author: S Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This recoil pad works great
customer_reviews.text: I put it on a .50 caliber black powder in-line rifle. This gun really thumps a shooter when using a maximum load. This pad takes some of the recoil away and makes it a bit more pleasant gun to shoot. I am glad that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Why they put a hard knuckle like corner on the top/rear is poor design
customer_reviews.text: Why they put a hard knuckle like corner on the top/rear is poor design. Unless you like a knuckle into your collarbone with trigger pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Your Shoulder Will Thank You
customer_reviews.text: Fits and looks great. The curved design allows plenty of room for the sling swivel mount. The pad fit fine with the factory "hard rubber" pad on the rifle, but I opted to remove the stock pad for a more stable fit. Well worth the money, and saves my shoulder from being slapped across the room like Daffy Duck's bill.
customer_reviews.author: ElectricBlue

customer_reviews.title: For Marlin 336W and Mosin Nagant Bolt Action Rifles
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Pachmayr Decelerator Slip-On Pad, Brown, small size for a Marlin 336W 30-30 lever action rifle that I got from Big 5. It fits snugly but not too tight and works perfectly. I had previously bought the same Pachmayr Decelerator Slip-On Pad, Brown, small size for an old Mosin Nagant bolt action rifle I also got from Big 5. This small size pad also fits and works very well on the Mosin. The small size does have a slight amount of play on the Mosin, however it still stays put nicely, including when firing. It holds in place well and really helps with the recoil, making it much for fun to shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Detroit Roll

customer_reviews.title: Good Product & Good Value
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, the product is an excellent value. I used for the first time today on my x-bolt .30-06 and the result was a material reduction in kick/abuse to my shooting shoulder. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Texas

customer_reviews.title: A great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 1891 Argentine Mauser I got when my dad passed away. The gun hadn't been fired in probably 25 years, but I remembered it kicked like a mule with the old pad he had on there. I took it out last weekend on a hunting trip and did some target shooting. The pad works like a dream. It made the gun really fun to shoot. I measured the stock of the gun really carefully before ordering. It went on really easy. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Hatsan Escort
customer_reviews.text: I love my Hatsan Escort pump - but the recoil pad that came with it was like a brick. After reading another review where the person installed this on their Hatsan shotty, I decided to give it a try. The MEDIUM size fits perfectly. I did what the reviewer did in taking off the old recoil pad and slipping this one in place - fit perfectly - almost looks like it came that way from the factory. So much softer than what was on there before and it does not slip or move around at all. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ccpff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my KELTEC KSG shotgun and it is a perfect fit. Looks pretty good for an add on but it does help with heavy punch you get from this gun.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Ruley

customer_reviews.title: Made a huge difference!
customer_reviews.text: This helped tremendously to counter the recoil. I had bruises before I found and bought this. This was perfect and even saved $10 here vs Cabella where they were sold out. I bought a medium for my Savage Arms.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Yugoslavian SKS. I love the rifle, but the length of pull is just a little too short for me. As a result, shouldering the rifle always seemed a little awkward. I purchased this product just to add some length to the butt of the gun. I went with a small-sized extender/decelerator and it fit perfectly. It adds just the right amount of length to the rifle so that now the overall length of pull feels natural and comfortable for me. It also fits on my Mosin Nagant rifles, which will come in handy both for the length of pull and absorbing a bit of the recoil. The only thing left to do is go to range.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob G.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Ruger 10/22
customer_reviews.text: Needed to increase length of pull by about an inch on a Ruger 10/22 with factory laminate stock. The small one fits snug and nearly perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: sailorcyte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit nice cushion
customer_reviews.text: Got small size after measuring stock at widest point and height. Perfect fit nice cushion. Shot 20 rounds yesterday with 12 gauge. Noticeable difference in terms of what shoulder feels like compared to without it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great quality gunstock pad at first.  Then it lost it's elastic ability.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a Beretta S685 that was a stock short length. I went by the sizing chart that was posted by someone else. My size was right on the line between a medium and a large, so I got the medium. Perfect tight fit and feels great. - Edited 11-2-15 - I shoot a little bit of trap and this fall the pad lost it's elastic ability. It moves around on the gun stock so bad that I have to re-adjust it after each shot. Now I'm trying to find a screw down pad that works as good as this pad once did.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Small size for Kel-Tec KS7
customer_reviews.text: Adds about an inch to length of pull. Slides on easily. Does not cover m-lock slots on stock so your sling will fit. Saves your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Works great on M1A's (Medium size)
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often, but I rarely seem to buy gun parts/accessories that just go on easy and work perfectly without issue. I measured the end of the buttstock and compared it against the review that has the size to inches listings. My Socom 16 M1A has a 5"x 2" buttstock end so I ordered a medium size pad. It fit really well, nice and tight. The pad isn't too squishy or firm and makes the length of pull perfect for me (adds 3/4"-1"). Pachmayr has always made great products and its nice to see something that works and is made tough so no worries about it holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great recoil pad
customer_reviews.text: This slip on recoil pad works great. I bought it for a mosin nagant and now use it on my SKS occasionally. It goes on easy and stays in place on both rifles. lowers recoil.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just wish the sleeve part was a little o
customer_reviews.text: Great, but I would love it more if it fully covered the length of pull expansion plates on my Ruger PCC. It does make for a nice soft shot though, so a minor kick.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: This pad is a fantastic addition to my rifle and I can't believe I ...
customer_reviews.text: Game changer! This pad is a fantastic addition to my rifle and I can't believe I didn't add one sooner. I tried it out at the range yesterday and the .30-06 recoil was greatly reduced. Medium fit my Winchester Model 70 perfectly; I had previously purchased a large, but it was definitely too big.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Yotz

customer_reviews.title: Less Pain
customer_reviews.text: Takes away the HURT from shooting the KSG 12 . Puts the gun in a more comfortable shoulder to trigger position. I have them on all my shotguns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great! 12 gauge trap shooting all day no issues. Send me some having a trap shooting event I will have other review as well.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good pad.  Small size is the right one for a Marlin 1894.  Don't like the slick harder plastic at the top of the pad.
customer_reviews.text: The small size fits perfectly on a Marlin 1894. Adds about 3/4" length of pull, which for me makes it more comfortable to sight and shoot. I docked a star because, if you'll notice the top of the pad there is a slight angled cut on it? For whatever reason the material there is a harder rubber or plastic, not soft like the other parts of the pad. This means if you try to lean your rifle in a corner on a wood floor (or similar hard smooth flooring), the bottom will slide out. Not a big deal for me but annoying enough to get my attention.
customer_reviews.author: Don N

customer_reviews.title: Reduces the felt recoil
customer_reviews.text: I went from waking up the next day with a bruised shoulder to only having a sore shoulder for part of the same day I go shooting. This may not make much of a felt difference in some large hunting caliber rifles but for target rounds out of a shotgun, the pad really did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Nate M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes shooting big boomers fun again
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my muzzleloader, a twenty some year old T/C White Mountain Carbine whose recoil pad has hardened with age. Significantly reduced the recoil. I also use it on my .338 Win. Mag. (Model 70) from the bench and can shoot 25-30 rounds with no discomfort. Makes shooting the big boomer fun again. Size small fits both.
customer_reviews.author: johnd

customer_reviews.title: no more mule kicks in the shoulder
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a 50s Savage Arms side by side 12ga. No pad at all. Before, without it, about 8 rounds left bruises and brush burns and sore/stiffness for days. This thing worked wonders. Great technology and design. Worth it! The only downsides are the extra length and that it does shift between shots a little. It's also pretty gripy, so for someone not practiced on it, they may catch/snag their shirt. But these are small tradeoffs to have a gun that you can shoot rather than one you can't shoot or shoot badly because of fear of or actual pain.
customer_reviews.author: CME

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: Own several of these and they really help. I'm getting older and my 30-06 leaves a mark now. This greatly reduces felt recoil and now lm not anticipating the recoil. Fits well and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: It does reduce the kick, but the thickness does ...
customer_reviews.text: It does reduce the kick, but the thickness does make targeting different. It stays on the butt well and does the job I asked of it. I will use it on the hunt!
customer_reviews.author: Rebelelement

customer_reviews.title: saves the shoulder and more
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my older shotguns because A: I have an inoperable stage 3 rotator cuff injury B. It adds a bit more length to the stock as stocks were shorter back in the day .C. I can easily add plastic shims to temporarily change the cant of the stock.( see B. above)
customer_reviews.author: cascade joe

customer_reviews.title: Fit like......well a glove!
customer_reviews.text: The medium size fits Remington 870 Express with a wood stock perfectly. Those of us who own this shotgun know finding a recoil pad is a pain in the rear. Buy this and move on!!
customer_reviews.author: RMillie

customer_reviews.title: Medium fits the Browning A5!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail, and put it on without much effort at all. I put this on my new Browning A5 to increase the length of pull. I ordered the medium, and it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and works great. I have a lightweight Savage 110 in .30-06 and it kicks like a mule with the 190-grain, 2700 fps handloads that I make. I took the stock butt pad off, and put this on over the bare wood, and it made a huge difference. Doesn't match the wood stock at all obviously, but if you're like me and you're more interested in a comfortable gun than a pretty gun, I'd buy one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Looks decent and good designed recoil pad!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a small and received a medium size in a small marked package! Will probably keep it since I can use on other guns. Should get what you ordered and paid for though!!
customer_reviews.author: TERRY B

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Stevens 320 perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a rubber lip on recoil absorber. The size small fits my Savage/Stevens 320 nice and snug but I did remove the factory butt pad because I didn't want the added length. If you want the added length you might want to order the medium. I haven't shot with it yet so I can't speak to it's efficiency, but the design looks like it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Mounts great
customer_reviews.text: The Speed-Mount insert is what makes this stand out from all competitors. I tried others and this is the best. It fits perfectly, reduces recoil, but best of all it has the patented hard insert call "Speed-Mount". This makes the gun slip perfectly onto your shoulder even if you mount slightly wrong it will not snag on your coat.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: Not for me!
customer_reviews.text: This recoil pad did not work for me. First of all it increased the length of pull by too much and made it difficult to get the correct eye relief with my rifle/scope set up.Second it has a little piece of hard plastic at the top of the pad which would sit right against my collar bone when shooting prone...Ouch!! I did fit snugly on my stock which is a monte carlo style and didn't slip around. I eventually purchased a Kick-eez grind to fit recoil pad that I am very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: Luke L.

customer_reviews.title: IT FIT GREAT AND WAS EASY TO PUT ON
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS GREAT AND MAY BUY ANOTHER ONE FOR ONE OF MY OTHER GUNS. WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PAD. LOOKS GREAT ON MY WIN DEFENDER .
customer_reviews.author: JOHN FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive slip on
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my Winchester 94, it’s comfortable and it slips on easy. It stays in place and it’s easy on the shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It's cheaper than other models on the market and works fine. I'm 6'8" and my length of pull is much greater than a stock gun. I bought the A300 put 2 inches of spacers on it and still needed a little extra. I didn't need the recoil reduction but this gave me just the little bit of length i needed to get the LOP correct. My only issue is it look smooth but its a little tacky. It doesn't bother me as much as I thought it would but it's no where near as sticky as the limbsaver model.
customer_reviews.author: Talloutdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these recoil pads in different sizes for my Milsurp rifles that I do not wish to alter and have metal butt plates. The recoil from those rifles is very unpleasant and these pads truly reduce the felt recoil as described. The small size fits my Mosin Nagant. 91/30 though just barely - it is almost loose and has just enough grip to be ok. I have used the medium sized on my Swiss K11 and fits perfectly. I would recomend this pad for rifles that you do not want to alter. These make my rifles a joy to shoot.
customer_reviews.author: SirDaddy

customer_reviews.title: ...sold me!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered appropriate size per manufacturer, I believe could be a little tighter fit. Easy to install. Added a double face foam tape between pad and gun's butt end to help from slipping. After about 15 shots noticed it slipping sideways. Repositioned it and firmly pressed on it. Didn't notice any other negative issues. On the positive great recoil reduction, shot over three boxes of high brass 12 gauge that day with no shoulder soreness at all, then or later. I'm sold.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Longacre

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Slipped onto my Marlin 917V perfectly. I didn't get it to absorb recoil (obviously) just to ad some LOP to fit me better. Feels real good.
customer_reviews.author: Becky & Pat  WA, state

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Put one on a Winchester 94AE loop carbine and the other on a Remington 870 Youth model. Both fit perfect, adjust the overall stock length to a more comfy range, and work great for recoil. I was concerned about the slip fit but they fit perfectly, creating a suction seal that keeps them from slipping off easily. The only negative I can see is that the grippy rubber can inhibit your bringing the rifle or shotgun up in a hurry. Might not be a plus for a home defense gun. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.B.

customer_reviews.title: SIZES! JUST LIST THE SIZES!!
customer_reviews.text: Small - 1-1/2 to 1-5/8 wide by 4-3/4 to 4-7/8 long Medium - 1-1/2 to 1-3/4 wide by 5 to 5-3/16 long Large - 1/34 to 1-7/8 wide by 5-3/16 to 5-7/17 long There they are. As far as the product goes, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: David

product_meta.title: Pachmayr Decelerator Slip On Recoil Pad
product_meta.description: No Gunsmithing required! Pachmayr’s Decelerator recoil pads provide the ultimate in recoil control and appearance and now you can install them on all your long guns. Designed to fit within .050 inch tolerance on factory stocks, these pads will enhance the look and feel of the gun, improve your shooting experience, and maybe help you bag more game. Features: - Easy “Do-It-Yourself” installation - Replaces hard factory pads - Custom “pre-ground” fit Size Large fits: Stock dimensions of 1-3/4" to 1-7/8" wide x 5-3/16" to 5-7/16" long, or will fit the following: Beretaa: 686, 687 Field models, 302, 303 Semi-Auto Browning: Citori with English Stock

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
